intro: Agalinis purpurea var. neoscotia, commonly known as the purplestem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its flowers are tubular and usually pink or purple, with two lips that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are opposite, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
